<<<<<<< HEAD
The upright Christian discovered by keeping himself from his iniquity, and resignation to the divine will. By way of question and answer. Gathered out of the judicious treatises of William Bates, D.D. Bates, William, 1625-1699.
22, [2] p.
printed for Jonathan Robinson, at the Golden Lion in St. Paul's Church Yard, London : 1693.
The last leaf is blank. Also issued as part of: "The almost Christian discovered", by Ezekiel Hopkins (Wing H2728). Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
